messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1174
messages.msgSnippet: Actually this time I guess we won t be coming as we just found out it is only a 5 day trip.  Hopefully in the near future he will be coming again. But if
messages.messageBody:
Actually this time I guess we won't be coming as we just found out it is
only a 5 day trip. Hopefully in the near future he will be coming again.
But if summer comes too quickly here, we will be swamped in plans we already
have. :0) Thanks for your thoughts and time. I will save them for the
future.


Angela in Maine. Unschooling Mom to two beautiful daughters. "Play is our
brain's favorite way to learn." Unknown
www.geocities.com/autonomousangela
! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1174
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/27/01 1:08:59 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/27/01 1:08:59 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Juli, whose daughter is vacuuming to rave music
because she wants the house nice for the exchange
student, not because I'll "allow" her to watch
football later.
>>


I'm glad I didn't blow through your message (I am way behind) , it was
great. I cannot stand this type of bribery myself. I am also against a
punishment/rewards system, schools are big on this. Write them!

NICKI~ whose dd takes the vacuum away and does it herself and loves to
take the trash down. Plus our dog and cat are way too clean for their taste.
:o)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1174
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/27/01 1:08:59 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/27/01 1:08:59 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Dh is taking a business trip near Valley Forge, PA. We are thinking about
joining him. Is there anybody close by that wants to get together with us?
We would be looking for something to keep us busy during the week while he
works and then sight seeing on the weekend. I am not sure if it will be one
or two weeks.
Angela in Maine >>

How much driving freedom will you have? I'm not in PA but grew up there.
Valley Forge itself is great. The museums in Phila. are great and go for the
Ben Franklin Institute for sure. Further afield I'd say Hawk Mountain,
Hershey Park (fun and choc.) merry Mead Farm in Lansdale area (great
ice-cream). There is a great train ride and such in Lancaster and I am
drawing a blank for the name ugh! Lancaster itself would be fun to tour
around.OH! If you all like walking around towns and such I'd hit NewHope and
then cross the bridge to Jersey......more shops and such (Frenchtown) You
could visit a winery in Bucks County, Buckingham Valley Vineyard they do
tours and such. I believe you can get something from the Chamber on covered
bridges and go from bridge to bridge, great scenery. Peddlers Village in
Bucks County is great too. How old are your kids? I'll keep thinking.

NICKI~
